intro: Siphocampylus neurotrichus, commonly known as the slender false foxglove, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant features slender, erect stems that bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are tubular and typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the top of the stem. Siphocampylus neurotrichus is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
